column4: hi all , i have a problem, firstly i installed windows xp, then in another partition installed ubuntu, but now when i try to boot .. i get "PXE-E61: Media test failure, check cable" and "PXE-M0F: Exiting Intel Boot Agent" , and can't load anything, please help me to figure out .. when was only windows it worked ok .. but after i installed ubuntu i got that problem :/
do you actuall boot using PXE ?
hm i don't know what's PXE
its a method for booting a remote OS, ie the OS would actually be on a PXE server
i just see that text now after i installed windows and ubuntu :/ earlier i didn't saw that
give me a few, im asking a friend on another server
ok thx
what all did you do ? just by reading that error, it soudns like maybe you're trying to boot from ethernt for some reason, whether you did it on accident, or by mistake
i installed windows , but didn't do anything with network
grub, or lilo ?
that is, do you mind reinstalling ? or is this a problem ?
well this method is a bit different than what you did, and it supposed to work
http://www.hevnikov.com/blog/2006/11/13/triple-boot-xp-vista-ubuntu-with-single-boot-screen/ just leave out the Vistas part
yeah, under the BIOS options for your card
you either 1) have an intel card that has boot from ethernet enabled, or 2) the option is in the BIOS
yes laptop
which distro ?
Edgy ?
it is a liveCD though yes ?
will it boot the LIveCD fine ?
do that then, when you get to the desktop, we'll try to see whats going on with menu.lst
huh sorry have to help to my family a little bit.. brb
when u'll be available just say d;-) Flannel k looking there
